item.title: Internet of things security years away from being fully baked, says Forrester | ZDNet
item.description:
Internet of things security years away from being fully baked, says Forrester | ZDNet

Many Internet of things technologies are in deployment among categories such as analytics, hardware and networking, but the vendor ecosystem needs to focus on security and standards, according to a Forrester Report. Anyone who perused the Internet of things dreams that surround smart homes and autos couldn't help but notice that security issues were glossed over at best and more often ignored.

item.title: In case you missed CES 2016: the cool hardware products at the HWTrek booth
item.description:
In case you missed CES 2016: the cool hardware products at the HWTrek booth

CES this year was fantastic. We were excited to see so many innovative creators at the event. But we also had an impressive array of products from HWTrek's creators and experts. In case you missed them, here is the list: Derived from the word Kiss+Messenger, Kissenger transfers kisses between long-distance lovers.

item.title: Cybersecurity: tailored responses to critical challenges
item.description:
Cybersecurity: tailored responses to critical challenges

Thales Cybersecurity in one minute. An essential operator of a city, an energy provider company is victim of a cyber-attack. The impact of the attack is increasing due to a lack of risk prevention. Thales, European leader in cybersecurity, is contacted to counter the cyber-attack.

item.title: The 30 Best Pieces of Advice for Entrepreneurs in 2015
item.description:
The 30 Best Pieces of Advice for Entrepreneurs in 2015

Last fall, we overheard that Twitter Engineering Director David Loftesness had some solid wisdom about training newly-minted engineering managers - an often precarious transition. So we sat down with him to see what tips he had to offer, and we were blown away.

item.title: 26 Disruptive Tech Trends for the Rest of the Decade
item.description:
26 Disruptive Tech Trends for the Rest of the Decade

Each year at this time, I read all of the predictions for the new year plus the "top X" lists wrapping out the previous year. Add to that the first week of chaos that is CES and all of the new tech debuting in Las Vegas.

item.title: 16 tech jobs that will be needed for the future of smart cities - TechRepublic
item.description:
16 tech jobs that will be needed for the future of smart cities - TechRepublic

Cities are becoming more populated and beginning to undergo digital transformations in order to innovate and move toward becoming a smart city. Building the infrastructure needed for a smart city is resulting in a demand for new job roles with new skill sets. The world is undergoing staggering urbanization, at the rate of 10,000 people per hour.
